image.altText: Vladimir Putin holding a press conference with Russian and Belarusian flags in the background.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump called Moscow's statement "promising" as Mr Putin underlined there were still "issues we need to discuss" about any truce

title.children: Putin backs 'idea' of Ukraine ceasefire, but says a truce deal needs work

image.altText: Crushed spodumene ore at the Talison Lithium mine in Greenbushes

props.synopsis: Resources Minister Madeleine King says Australia has other buyers for critical minerals that interest Donald Trump, as the government continues "tough" tariff talks.

title.children: 'We've got options' on critical minerals, Labor warns US

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says it's unlikely the influencer would return to Australia in the future, due to the "level of scrutiny" her visa application would receive.

title.children: Influencer who snatched baby wombat from its mother has visa reviewed

image.altText: The words ‘No Change To WA GST’ have been scrawled on a reporter's arm and signed by Anthony Albanese.

props.synopsis: A refresh of the GST carve-up today could see Victoria shift from being a relative contributor to a beneficiary for the first time.

title.children: Victoria could tip from 'giver' to 'taker' in today's GST carve-up

image.altText: Woman wearing pink jumper opens a weight loss injection pen with semaglutide solution.

props.synopsis: Health experts are concerned Ozempic and other GLP-1 agonist drugs may be inappropriately prescribed to people experiencing disordered eating.

title.children: Ozempic and eating disorder concerns prompt calls for more screening

image.altText: Donald Trump points his finger, wearing a red tie

props.synopsis: A trade war is escalating between the US and Europe with Trump taking to social media to threaten the EU with 200 per cent tariffs on alcohol.

title.children: Trump threatens EU with tariffs on alcohol, including wine and champagne

image.altText: Children collect water from a truck using plastic jugs and jerry cans.

props.synopsis: A water desalination plant in central Gaza, which had been repaired just a few months ago, is now without power after Israel switched off supply to the strip.

title.children: Israel's decision to cut power to Gaza hits the strip's water supplies

image.altText: A group of men in combat gear stand in rubble

props.synopsis: The Israeli government has rejected the findings of the UN report, which accused it of using "genocidal acts" and sexual violence as a war strategy in Gaza.

title.children: UN experts accuse Israel of 'genocidal acts' and sexual violence in Gaza

image.altText: A poster attached to a power pole saying that needle sharing leads to HIV infection.

props.synopsis: Fiji health authorities are scrambling to stem an outbreak of HIV, as growing meth use and alarming needle-sharing trends accelerate the spread of the virus.

title.children: How 'bluetoothing' fuelled HIV outbreak — and caught Fiji unprepared

image.altText: A man in his 70s pointing a finger at the camera

props.synopsis: Police reveal details about what happened in the tense 12-hour stand-off during the arrest of former Philippine president Rodrigo Duterte this week.

title.children: 'You'll have to kill me': Inside the 12-hour arrest of ex-Philippine president

image.altText: person with parachute jumping off tall sand dune

props.synopsis: School holiday travel plans have been thrown into turmoil after ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred left a trail of destruction along the east coast, prompting pleas from tourism operators for holiday-makers not to cancel their Easter getaways.

title.children: Families urged to stick with beach plans despite mass erosion from ex-Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A man in sleeveless shirt and serious expression

props.synopsis: Army veteran Mathew Whitbread, 49, was fit and healthy when he contracted melioidosis while mud crabbing in north Queensland. It nearly killed him.

title.children: Survivor of unprecedented melioidosis outbreak says he died twice

image.altText: A fire on the top of a building.

props.synopsis: More than 430 people have are evacuated from a Surfers Paradise hotel after part of the roof caught on fire.

title.children: Burning debris falls into street as Gold Coast Hilton hotel catches fire

image.altText: Dutton Australian flag concern

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is tantalisingly close to power, but the last steps will be the hardest.

title.children: Do voters fear PM Peter Dutton would be a surprise packet?

image.altText: An ASX board with ASX in focus and stock prices out of focus.

props.synopsis: A sell-off on Wall St was led by fears of recession as the ongoing trade war between the United States and its biggest trading partners continues. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to open lower after Wall Street slides, S&P 500 enters correction

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump threatens huge tariffs on alcohol from EU

props.synopsis: Donald Trump, a long time electric vehicle sceptic, is now the owner of a brand new Tesla. But can the US president’s new found love for EVs save the brand, with Tesla stock tumbling since CEO Elon Musk took on his high profile role in the Trump administration?

title.children: Has Elon Musk made driving a Tesla uncool?

image.altText: A couple embracing from the inside of a homelessness support facility.

props.synopsis: A Brisbane charity is refusing to take tents away from homeless people as the council warns it is breaking a law that holds a maximum penalty of more than $8,000.

title.children: Charity refuses to take tents for homeless away as council threatens fines

image.altText: A short woman with auburn hair is surrounded by men walking and looking serene

props.synopsis: Queen Camilla has been a vocal campaigner for supporting survivors of rape and abuse.

title.children: Queen writes personal letter to rape survivor Gisele Pelicot

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Donald Trump turned the White House lawn into a Tesla showroom on Tuesday as he attempted to buoy his ally's brand. But can he even drive the car he bought?

title.children: Why Donald Trump can’t drive the Tesla he just bought

image.altText: woman with bills

props.synopsis: Six councils in south-west Queensland have banded together to protest an eye-watering increase in insurance premiums of up to 300 per cent.

title.children: Flood insurers 'having a lend' as premiums triple in parts of outback Qld

image.altText: A storm rolling in over the beach in Yeppoon.

props.synopsis: Showers are expected across coastal parts of the state today, with some regions on the tropical north coast picking up an excess of 100 millimetres overnight.

title.children: Rainfall expected in parts of Qld as clean-up continues after cyclone

image.altText: Scabies mite magnified.

props.synopsis: A new tool to test for scabies is being trialled by doctors in the Northern Territory, with researchers hoping early diagnosis could prevent people with the skin infestation from developing other life-threatening illnesses.

title.children: World-first scabies diagnostic tool could help prevent heart disease

image.altText: Beth, pregnant with her second surrogacy arrangement, and Dan and Tyson with daughter London.

props.synopsis: ABC podcast Ladies, We Need to Talk takes an emotional rollercoaster with two women who open up about their experiences of surrogacy, the fallout when things don't go to plan and the joy it can bring when they do.

title.children: The heartbreak and joy of surrogacy, from two women who gave birth for someone else

image.altText: A man leans on a fence looking into a fenced off area, the word 'scabs' is spelt out in coffee cups through the fence

props.synopsis: The 1998 waterfront dispute was one of the most significant industrial disputes in Australia, but what happened to those who were recruited to keep the wharves running?

title.children: From 'scabs' to unemployed: The recruits caught up in the waterfront dispute

image.altText: Two women hug each other while listening to a man.

props.synopsis: One Of Them Days has come out of nowhere to become the third-highest-grossing film of 2025 in the US.

title.children: SZA's first acting gig is in this adults-only buddy comedy

image.altText: A coach looks on before a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Initially, Newcastle's Adam O'Brien stayed silent on his club signing Dylan Brown but now the Knights coach has explained why he stayed quiet while also explaining why the incoming playmaker can be a perfect fit in the Hunter.

title.children: Why Knights coach Adam O'Brien stayed silent on Dylan Brown signing

image.altText: A coach looks perplexed after losing an AFL match

props.synopsis: With top draft pick Sam Lalor in the thick of the action, an inspired Richmond outfit came from behind to defeat Carlton by 13 points at the MCG as Blues coach Michael Voss bemoaned his club's lack of fight.

title.children: Voss 'couldn't be more disappointed' after Carlton fell to Richmond

image.altText: Part of a retaining wall sitting on soil that has slid away.

props.synopsis: Some residents who were forced to evacuate their homes following a landslide in January are still locked out of their properties due to ongoing safety risks, and they've been dealt another blow after being targeted by thieves.

title.children: Mornington Peninsula properties 'ransacked' after being evacuated due to landslide

image.altText: A diptych compiling three screenshots showing extensive damage at a social housing estate.

props.synopsis: Amid a housing crisis, a social housing complex in Melbourne's south-east sits empty for more than six months — and was broken into and vandalised — after residents were suddenly relocated to make way for a redevelopment.

title.children: Tenants were moved out of their homes. Then the dwellings sat empty for months

image.altText: Laura Peel celebrates by holding up her skis

props.synopsis: Laura Peel's stunning triple twisting, triple back somersault handed her a fifth World Cup gold of the season and a third overall title on the Olympic jump in Italy.

title.children: Peel claims overall World Cup title with exhilarating gold on Olympic jump

image.altText: Trees along a riverbank.

props.synopsis: As one end of the country contends with the fallout from ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred, another part of Australia is battling the opposite conditions. Hopes that water will make its way south are evaporating fast, with experts saying conditions are too dry.

title.children: Little hope for ex-cyclone flows in NSW, Victoria and SA, experts warn

image.altText: Innovators1

props.synopsis: Steve Johnson's innovative kicking at goal has become an accepted part of Aussie rules, but if not for the inspiration of a Magpies legend, it may never have been used.

title.children: How a Collingwood champ helped inspire a Geelong kicking innovation

image.altText: woman wearing blue scarf and husband with his arm around her shoulders both smiling at camera

props.synopsis: As Australians shake their heads at the prospect of another increase in power prices, this Victorian couple have gone green with their home and business and won't pay an energy bill for years.

title.children: No power bill for 'next 10 years' as couple takes whole life off-grid
